subject: RE: [junit] Experience with jdk1.4 assert keyword
msgSnippet: ... Why is something like assert foo != null : Foo null ; a bad thing?
messageBody:
> >and certainly NOT a way to enforce runtime checks.
>
> They are certainly bad if you use them to catch bugs in
> production code "before they happen" (example: testing
> for null in a place where you should never get a null
> reference), in the same way that it's a bad idea to use
> exceptions to control normal program flow.

Why is something like
assert foo != null : "Foo null";
a bad thing?
